results.title: To Sing Our Own Song: Philippines
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World about Us: Third Eye”.
One of a series of programs in which individuals describe the developing countries in which they live. Josae Diokno, former Secretary of Justice in the Philippines’ government is a victim of his outspoken views. A leading intellectual figure of dissent in the Third World, he spent two years in jail for hostile criticism of the martial law imposed by President Marcos.

results.title: Briefing
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Discussion starter looking at the problem of an individual receiving information from a group. Three executives are briefing a new designer and digress to such an extent that at the end of the briefing the designer still has to ask what the product was. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Well, if you ask me
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Discussion starter looking at the difficulties of eliciting opinions from within a group. Two executives are clear in their objections to the location of a new plant. However, once inside the boardroom they say nothing and the proposal is passed without objection. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Decision makers
results.creator_credit: Victorian Film Corporation and Seven Dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working together”.
Looks at the problem of small group decision-making. An inadequately briefed syndicate group wastes time deciding what it is supposed to be discussing. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The One that got away
results.creator_credit: Gillian Coote, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. School teacher, Lowell decided to give up teaching, get away from the hassles of living and working in the city and become a fisherman. He and his family enjoy living in the peaceful bush in a cottage with few modern amenities. His parents on the other hand cannot understand his attitude. Photographed by Paul Tait, edited by Lana Bennett, sound by Rowland McManus.

results.title: Clockwork lemon
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Shows the effects of technological change on the worker in the printing industry. Do computers take away the enjoyment of the job? Have a lot of skills been lost? Is job security at risk?

results.title: Think big
results.creator_credit: Susan Doring, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about the place of work in people’s lives. To be really successful one needs determination and hard work. Many executives put work before the family causing conflicts, but a choice has to be made. Two executives, a man and a married woman discuss their jobs.
